components.description:
A graph showing a colored trend line, often blue, decreasing over time, as stock prices or revenues. Commonly used to represent various types of decrease, from numeral data to being metaphorically down. May also represent facts, figures, and charts more generally.

WhatsApp’s line is red, while Facebook’s orange. Google’s line was previously green.

While many western countries use red to indicate a negative result, Japan and other south east Asian countries use red in a positive context.
components.title: Chart with Downwards Trend

title: Chart with Downwards Trend

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Office symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A chart showing figures decreasingÂ over time, with an downwardÂ trend. A type of line graph. Chart Decreasing was approved as part of Unicode http://emojipedia.org/chart-with-downwards-trend/

bn:00101752a: Being or moving lower in position or less in some value

bn:00101753a: From the higher end to the lower of.
Extending or moving from a higher to a lower place
From one end to another; especially, from a higher end to a lower.

To visually represent by means of a graph.

bn:00086769v: Make a schematic or technical drawing of that shows interactions among variables or how something is constructed

bn:00041412n: In mathematics, the graph of a function f is the collection of all ordered pairs.
A visual representation of the relations between certain quantities plotted with reference to a set of axes
In mathematics, a visual representation of the relations between certain quantities plotted according to a set of axes.

bn:03468279n: The process of presenting the content of a topic to an audience.
A presentation is the process of presenting a topic to an audience.

bn:00076496n: A general direction in which something tends to move
The general drift, tendency, or bent of a set of statistical data as related to time or another related set of statistical data.
An inclination in a particular direction.
A general tendency or inclination, typically determined by the examination of a particular attribute over time.

bn:00074061n: A branch of applied mathematics concerned with the collection and interpretation of quantitative data and the use of probability theory to estimate population parameters
The body of techniques used in statistical inference concerning a population.
Statistics is the study of the collection, analysis, interpretation, presentation and organization of data.
Statistics is a mathematical science pertaining to the collection, analysis, interpretation and presentation of data.
Study of the collection, organization, analysis, interpretation, and presentation of data
A branch of mathematics dealing with the collection, analysis, interpretation, and presentation of masses of numerical data.
A mathematical science concerned with data collection, presentation, analysis, and interpretation.

bn:00017904n: A chart is a graphical representation of data, in which "the data is represented by symbols, such as bars in a bar chart, lines in a line chart, or slices in a pie chart".
A graphic or diagram that displays data or the relationships between sets of data in pictorial rather than numeric form.
Small guide explaining symbols or terminology.
A guide explaining the symbols or terminology of a map or chart; a legend.
